revised_title: Quantum Corrections to the Depolarization Ratios of Scattered Laser Light
tldr: The authors conducted experiments using a helium-neon gas laser to measure the depolarization ratios of various simple molecules. They found that quantum corrections, such as frequency changes due to rotational Raman scattering and changes in molecular polarizability with rotational state, significantly affect the depolarization ratios. These corrections help improve the understanding of molecular properties and their interactions with light.
